answers.answer: You might've eaten something spoiled.  Do you feel any contractions or pains?

No I don't feel any pains but I don't think I ate anything spoiled.  I had a pancake, 1 egg, and 3 pieces of bacon for breakfast.  Then when I started to feel nauseous, I ate a few pickles with salt because it's always helped me with nausea in the past.  Everything was fresh and well cooked so I really don't think that's the problem.  In the past few minutes I've started to feel a little lightheaded as well.  I'm not sure what's going on.
I'd suggest calling your dr.  Better be safe.   Hope you feel better soon and keep us posted.
I agree when in doubt check it out. Call the doctor!

I spoke to a nurse at my doctors office and she said that there is some type of virus going around and I may have it.  She called in a prescription for some anti-nausea medicine and told me if I don't get better by tomorrow to call back.  This is the pits!

Have you had your blood pressure checked lately.  I know the diarrhea would not fit but sometimes nausea and vomitting can be a sign of preeclampsia.  I would check your blood pressure just to be safe also.  Hang in there and I hope you feel better soon.
I was going to say it sounds like a flu. It's too late in the pregnancy for morning sickness. I'd call the dr. just to make sure it's nothing major
Definitely sounds like a stomach virus. I had it really bad when I was pregnant too. Hope you feel better soon.
I'd agree it's probably a virus but best to get checked out just to be sure.Hope you have a speedy recovery,Ruth xx
The medicine eventually worked and the next day I felt a lot better.  I guess it was a 24 hour bug or something but thank God it's gone.  Thanks to everyone for the advice.

question: I am 34 weeks 1 day pregnant and I started having some issues today.  I felt nauseous earlier today and tried to eat to soothe my stomach.  I felt a little better for a while then I got diarrhea.  Less than one hour after that I started throwing up for around 2 minutes straight.  I NEVER throw up.  I didn't in my first pregnancy and didn't in this pregnancy until today.  Is it normal to have these symptoms so late in pregnancy?  What do they mean?  I have a doctor's appointment on Wednesday but I'm wondering if I need to get checked out before then or if this is normal.  I still feel a bit queasy and like I may be getting diarrhea again.  What the heck is going on?  Any advice would be appreciated.
title: Problem at 34 weeks
